definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to weave/to knit/to plait/to braid/(fig.) to create (sth abstract, e.g. a dream, a lie etc)

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1

definition: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, OECD/abbr. for 經濟合作與發展組織|经济合作与发展组织
UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

sentences.english: So she decided to knit a woolen sweater for the man.
sentences.chinese: 於是她決定爲那個男人織一件羊毛衣。

sentences.english: Mark weaving Chapter applies to clothing, handbags and so on.
sentences.chinese: 織嘜章適用於服裝，皮包等。

sentences.english: It gives the most beautiful maple woven Dahongpao.
sentences.chinese: 它給楓樹織的紅袍最漂亮。

sentences.english: Convince the Songweaver to join you.
Blanket woven, went to learn Ed.
sentences.chinese: 毛毯織不齊，就去學編席。

sentences.english: A gown made of the finest wool.
sentences.chinese: 用最細的羊毛織一條長袍。

sentences.english: Warbler weave such a big ask, what?
sentences.chinese: 黃鶯問它織這麼大幹什麼？

sentences.english: Knit, the women beat the umbrella son stroll rain in.
sentences.chinese: 織，仕女打着傘兒漫步雨中。

sentences.english: She's knitting her husband a pair of socks.
She put on a comforter and went out.
sentences.chinese: 她戴上一條長毛織圍巾就出去了。

sentences.english: Mother often knits while watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 母親看電視時常織東西。

sentences.english: To make a doily or lace, you use thin thread and a small hook.
sentences.chinese: 爲了織一盤墊或花邊，您可以使用超薄串和一個小鉤。

sentences.english: Wu Min pulled his sweater and knitted his scarf.
sentences.chinese: 吳敏拆了毛衣自己織圍巾。

sentences.english: You could use circular needle and work magic loop for the sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用魔術環針圈織法織袖子。

definition: to fold/to fold over in layers/to furl/to layer/to pile up/to repeat/to duplicate
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
